senses.de: A set of clothes made from the same fabric, usually including a jacket and trousers or a jacket and skirt.
senses.ex: He wore a dark blue business suit to the meeting.

Tips.title: Professional Dress
Tips.description: Wearing a suit often signifies professionalism and is expected in certain workplaces.
Tips.example: For your job interview, make sure to wear a suit to present yourself professionally.

Tips.title: Formal Events
Tips.description: Suits are typical attire for formal events like weddings or dinners.
Tips.example: He bought a new suit for his sister's wedding.

senses.de: One of the four sets of cards in a deck - hearts, diamonds, clubs, spades.
senses.ex: He had a strong hand - a full house of the highest suit.

Tips.title: Card Games
Tips.description: In card games, 'suit' refers to one of the categories cards are divided into.
Tips.example: Could you sort the cards by suit before we start the game?

Tips.title: Strategy Importance
Tips.description: In many card games, the suit can determine the strength or value of a hand.
Tips.example: In bridge, spades are generally the highest suit.

senses.de: An act of making a legal claim.
senses.ex: She decided to bring a suit against her former employer.

Tips.title: Legal Action
Tips.description: A 'suit' can also mean taking someone to court through a formal legal process.
Tips.example: The company faced a suit for breach of contract.

senses.de: To be right or proper for.

Tips.title: Personal Preference
Tips.description: 'Suit' as a verb means something fits one's personal taste or preference.
Tips.example: These curtains don't suit my taste; they're too bright.

Tips.title: Occasion Appropriateness
Tips.description: Using 'suit' indicates appropriateness for a specific time, place or event.
Tips.example: This casual outfit won't suit a formal event like the gala.

senses.de: To meet the needs or requirements of.

Tips.title: Meeting Requirements
Tips.description: When something 'suits' a purpose, it means it meets the requirements or needs.
Tips.example: The software update should suit our needs for faster data processing.

senses.de: A man dressed in a conventional or formal way, often working in an office or in business.
senses.ex: The bar was full of suits discussing corporate matters.

Tips.title: Corporate Stereotype
Tips.description: Calling someone a 'suit' can be stereotyping them as a corporate worker, often with a negative tone.
Tips.example: The office was full of suits making decisions without consulting the staff.

Tips.title: Informal Usage
Tips.description: 'Suits' used to describe people is informal and may be perceived as disrespectful if used improperly.
Tips.example: The suits upstairs haven't thought this through well enough.

Apparel.wordDefinition:
Apparel generally refers to any type of clothing worn on the body, whereas suit specifically refers to a matching set of clothing consisting of a jacket and trousers or skirt.

Apparel is a broader term that can include a variety of clothing items like shirts, dresses, pants, and more.

Suit is often used in more formal settings, like for business or special occasions. So, while a suit would fall under the category of apparel, not all apparel would be considered a suit.

Attire.wordDefinition:
Attire refers to clothing in general, whereas a suit specifically refers to a matching set of formal clothing items such as a jacket, pants or skirt, and possibly a vest or tie.

Attire can be more casual or formal depending on the context, while suits are generally considered to be formal attire.

Attire can be applicable in many situations, from everyday wear to special occasions, while suits are usually reserved for formal events such as weddings or a job interview.

Costume.wordDefinition:
A costume is clothing worn for a particular occasion or to represent a particular character, such as for Halloween or a theater performance.

A costume is typically worn for fun or entertainment purposes, while a suit is worn for more serious or formal occasions.

Dress.wordDefinition:
A dress is typically a one-piece garment that covers the body from the shoulders to the hem. It's often worn by women on formal occasions, like weddings or cocktail parties.

A dress is a one-piece garment worn by women on formal occasions, while a suit is a set of separate pieces worn by both men and women in professional or formal settings.

Ensemble.wordDefinition:
Ensemble refers to a complete outfit or a group of performers who work together to create a piece of music or play. It is applicable in the context of fashion as well as performing arts.

For example, a complete outfit involving a shirt, pants, and a jacket can be referred to as an ensemble.

Similarly, a group of musicians or actors working together on a performance can also be referred to as an ensemble.

Ensemble can refer to any complete outfit or group of performers, while suit specifically refers to formal wear.

Garb.wordDefinition:
Garb refers to any type of clothing or attire, especially distinctive or unusual clothing that is worn for a special occasion, such as traditional Indian garb worn during festivals.

It can also refer to garments that specific professions may wear, such as medical garb or chef garb.

Garb describes clothing that is specific to a certain situation or purpose.

Garb can refer to any type of clothing, whereas a suit is a specific type of formal attire.

Outfit.wordDefinition:
Outfit can refer to any clothing worn together, such as a shirt, pants, and shoes.

It can also refer to a special set of clothing worn for a particular purpose, such as a sports outfit or a formal outfit.

Suits are often made from finer materials and are designed to be more formal and professional-looking than regular outfits.

The main difference between the two is that an outfit can refer to any combination of clothing, while a suit is a specific type of formal attire made up of matching pieces.

Uniform.wordDefinition:
A uniform is a set of clothes worn by a group of people to signify their affiliation or profession.

Suits are commonly worn by people in office jobs or for special occasions, such as weddings or job interviews. Uniforms are worn by people in certain jobs or professions, such as police officers or military personnel.

The main difference between suits and uniforms is that suits are worn to look professional or formal, while uniforms are worn to signify a specific group or profession.
